description: The SCD segment contains cycle data representing an instance of a sterilization or decontamination.

1.name: Cycle Start Time
1.description: The time that the load cycle begins.

11.name: Cycle Start Date/Time
11.description: The date and time that the cycle started.

12.name: Dry Time
12.description: The amount of cycle time spent drying the load.

13.name: Leak Rate
13.description: The amount of pressure that the chamber can hold expressed as barometric pressure.

14.name: Control Temperature
14.description: Amount of overdrive above the sterilize temperature.

15.name: Sterilizer Temperature
15.description: The current temperature in the anti-microbial device.

16.name: Cycle Complete Time
16.description: The time of day that the cycle completed.

17.name: Under Temperature
17.description: The temperature reached during a cycle, which fell below the required temperature range.

18.name: Over Temperature
18.description: The temperature reached during a cycle, which exceeded the required temperature.

19.name: Abort Cycle
19.description: A notification that the cycle was aborted. Refer to HL7 Table 0532 - Expanded yes/no indicator table in Chapter 2 for valid values.

2.name: Cycle Count
2.description: The number of cycles that have been completed.

20.name: Alarm
20.description: A notification that the time, temperature, or pressure reached is invalid for a specific phase of a cycle. Refer to HL7 Table 0532 - Expanded yes/no indicator table in Chapter 2 for valid values.

21.name: Long in Charge Phase
21.description: A notification that the charge phase in the cycle has exceeded the maximum time allowed. Refer to HL7 Table 0532 - Expanded yes/no indicator table in Chapter 2 for valid values.

22.name: Long in Exhaust Phase
22.description: A notification that the exhaust phase in the cycle has exceeded the maximum time allowed. Refer to HL7 Table 0532 - Expanded yes/no indicator table in Chapter 2 for valid values.

23.name: Long in Fast Exhaust Phase
23.description: A notification that the fast exhaust phase in the cycle has exceeded the maximum time allowed. Refer to HL7 Table 0532 - Expanded yes/no indicator table in Chapter 2 for valid values.

24.name: Reset
24.description: An indicator that specific anti-microbial device parameters have been set to system defaults. Refer to HL7 Table 0532 - Expanded yes/no indicator table in Chapter 2 for valid values.

25.name: Operator - Unload
25.description: The name of the operator that unloaded the anti-microbial device.
25.data_type: XCN - Extended Composite ID Number and Name for Persons

26.name: Door Open
26.description: An indicator that the door is open. Refer to HL7 Table 0532 - Expanded yes/no indicator table in Chapter 2 for valid values.

27.name: Reading Failure
27.description: A notification that an error was encountered while reading the cycle data for a specific cycle. Refer to HL7 Table 0532 - Expanded yes/no indicator table in Chapter 2 for valid values.

28.name: Cycle Type
28.description: The type of cycle that is being executed. A cycle type is a specific sterilization method used for a specific type of supply item.

29.name: Thermal Rinse Time
29.description: The amount of time spent in the thermal rinse phase of a decontamination cycle.

3.name: Temp Max
3.description: The maximum temperature achieved during a specific cycle.

30.name: Wash Time
30.description: The amount of time spent in the wash phase of a decontamination cycle.

31.name: Injection Rate
31.description: The injection rate of a wash or dry agent.

32.name: Procedure Code
32.description: The unique identifier indicating the type of procedure performed on the patient with the supplies being sterilized.

33.name: Patient Identifier List
33.description: The unique identifier associating the patient with the supplies being sterilized.
33.data_type: CX - Extended Composite ID with Check Digit

34.name: Attending Doctor
34.description: The unique identifier associating the physician with the supplies being sterilized, used for the procedure and patient identified in this message. Refer to User-defined Table 0010 - Physician ID for suggested values.
34.data_type: XCN - Extended Composite ID Number and Name for Persons

35.name: Dilution Factor
35.description: The dilution ratio of peracetic acid to water.

36.name: Fill Time
36.description: The amount of time spent in filling the sterilizer chamber with dilutant.

37.name: Inlet Temperature
37.description: The temperature of the dilutant upon entering the sterilizer chamber.

4.name: Temp Min
4.description: The minimum temperature achieved during a specific cycle.

5.name: Load Number
5.description: A number assigned to the load by the anti-microbial device. This number is incremented by the machine per cycle during the day and reset at midnight.

6.name: Condition Time
6.description: The actual amount of cycle time spent in the conditioning phase. For example, in a pre-vac sterilizer the condition phase is achieved by pulsing the machine six times to create a vacuum.

7.name: Sterilize Time
7.description: The actual amount of cycle time spent sterilizing supplies.

8.name: Exhaust Time
8.description: The actual amount of cycle time spent draining pressure from the sterilizer chamber.

9.name: Total Cycle Time
9.description: The sum of time spent in all phases of a cycle.
